channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: UConn takes 12th NCAA women's basketball title with dominant win over South Carolina
item.description: UConn is back on top of women's basketball, winning its 12th NCAA national championship by routing defending champion South Carolina 82-59 on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
UConn is back on top of women's basketball, winning its 12th NCAA national championship by routing defending champion South Carolina 82-59 on Sunday.

(Image credit: Chris O'Meara)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Alex Ovechkin scores goal #895 to break Wayne Gretzky's all-time NHL scoring record
item.description: The Washington Capitals star made history with a power play goal from the left faceoff circle — as Gretzky, who last set the record more than 25 years ago, looked on.
item.content:encoded:
The Washington Capitals star made history with a power play goal from the left faceoff circle — as Gretzky, who last set the record more than 25 years ago, looked on.

(Image credit: Bruce Bennett)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Severe storms and floods batter South and Midwest, as death toll rises to at least 18
item.description: Severe storms continued to pound parts of the South and Midwest, as a punishing and slow-moving storm system unleashed life-threatening flash floods and powerful tornadoes from Mississippi to Kentucky.
item.content:encoded:
Severe storms continued to pound parts of the South and Midwest, as a punishing and slow-moving storm system unleashed life-threatening flash floods and powerful tornadoes from Mississippi to Kentucky.

(Image credit: Carolyn Kaster/AP)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill at least 32, mostly women and children
item.description: Israeli strikes on Gaza killed at least 32 people, including over a dozen women and children, local health officials said Sunday, as Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu headed to meet President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli strikes on Gaza killed at least 32 people, including over a dozen women and children, local health officials said Sunday, as Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu headed to meet President Trump.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: RFK Jr. visits epicenter of Texas measles outbreak after death of second child
item.description: A second school-aged child in West Texas has died from a measles-related illness, a hospital spokesman confirmed Sunday, as the outbreak continues to swell.
item.content:encoded:
A second school-aged child in West Texas has died from a measles-related illness, a hospital spokesman confirmed Sunday, as the outbreak continues to swell.

(Image credit: Annie Rice)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Vietnam asks Trump to delay implementation of tariffs while the two sides negotiate
item.description: Vietnam is actively seeking to negotiate a reduction in the high tariff rate imposed by the Trump Administration.
item.content:encoded:
Vietnam is actively seeking to negotiate a reduction in the high tariff rate imposed by the Trump Administration.

(Image credit: Hau Dinh)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Yemen Houthi rebels say latest US strikes killed 2, day after Trump posted bomb video
item.description: Suspected U.S. airstrikes killed at least two people in a stronghold of Yemen's Houthi rebels, the group said Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
Suspected U.S. airstrikes killed at least two people in a stronghold of Yemen's Houthi rebels, the group said Sunday.

(Image credit: Osamah Abdulrahman)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 1 killed in Russian attack on Kyiv as death toll from missile strike rises to 19
item.description: One person was killed Sunday as Russian air strikes hit the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, while the death toll from Friday's deadly attack on the central Ukrainian city of Kryvyi Rih continued to rise.
item.content:encoded:
One person was killed Sunday as Russian air strikes hit the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, while the death toll from Friday's deadly attack on the central Ukrainian city of Kryvyi Rih continued to rise.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: For these seniors, DOGE's affordable housing pause means suffering longer without AC
item.description: The Trump administration froze funding for a program to upgrade aging low-income housing and make it energy efficient. The move threatens hundreds of projects around the country.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration froze funding for a program to upgrade aging low-income housing and make it energy efficient. The move threatens hundreds of projects around the country.

(Image credit: Carlos Bernate)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: In 'free' Khartoum, the ruined streets smell of perfume and music plays
item.description: Sudanese activist Duaa Tariq, who spoke to NPR throughout the war, shares what its like in the "liberated" capital Khartoum, after two years occupied by the Rapid Support Forces
item.content:encoded:
Sudanese activist Duaa Tariq, who spoke to NPR throughout the war, shares what its like in the "liberated" capital Khartoum, after two years occupied by the Rapid Support Forces

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett
